name: IKEA_desk_assembly_multi_ending
description: Assembly process with multiple possible outcomes (successes and failures)

states.description: Unopened IKEA desk box with instruction manual on top
Box opened, components laid out, instruction manual read carefully
Box torn open, components scattered, instruction manual tossed aside
Following instructions step-by-step, all parts organized by number
Desk frame assembled correctly, checking alignment before final tightening
Perfect assembly: desk is stable, all screws tight, perfectly aligned, looks professional
Attempting assembly by intuition, some confusion about which parts go where
Frustrated and confused, considering giving up
Gave up halfway: partially assembled desk on floor, tools scattered, person walking away defeated
Desk frame assembled but some parts seem loose, continuing anyway
Good assembly: desk is functional and stable, minor cosmetic imperfections
Acceptable assembly: desk works but wobbles slightly, some screws could be tighter
Desk frame assembled incorrectly, using wrong screws in some places
Wrong assembly: followed wrong instructions, desk looks strange and parts don't fit properly
Structural failure: desk collapsed when weight was placed on it, critical screws were missing

actions.description: Open box carefully and read instruction manual thoroughly
Tear open box and toss instructions aside, attempt assembly by intuition
Methodically follow each instruction step, double-checking each connection
Take a breath, re-read instructions, continue methodically
Carefully tighten all screws, check stability, adjust alignment
Try to figure it out without instructions, guessing which parts connect
Become frustrated with confusing parts, consider giving up
Throw hands up in frustration and walk away from half-assembled desk
Rush to finish without checking, just want to be done
Quickly tighten main screws, skip detailed checks
Loosely tighten screws, desk wobbles but seems okay
Use whatever screws fit, not checking part numbers
Place heavy object on desk to test stability
